intro: Psychotria ficigemma, commonly known as the red-eyed cycad. This plant is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its stout, unbranched stem and large, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Psychotria ficigemma is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in warm, humid environments.
